summary: This document is an email containing a summary of a New York Times article reporting that Melinda French Gates's decision to seek a divorce from Bill Gates was partly due to her displeasure with his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. It details multiple meetings between Bill Gates and Epstein, including dinners, flights on Epstein's jet, and a meeting arranged by Epstein with Leon Black.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Subject of the article; his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein is reported as a contributing factor to his divorce from Melinda French Gates. He met with Epstein multiple times, flew on his private jet, and attended gatherings at his townhouse.

persons.name: Melinda French Gates
persons.role: Philanthropist, former wife of Bill Gates
persons.context: Reportedly began consulting divorce lawyers after learning new details about her husband Bill Gates's interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, having previously expressed discomfort with the relationship.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document details his social and attempted business relationships with Bill Gates, including dinners, meetings at his townhouse, and introducing Gates to Leon Black. He died by suicide in federal custody in 2019.

persons.name: Ms. Arnold
persons.context: Provided statements defending Bill Gates's interactions with Epstein, claiming they were only to discuss philanthropy and that Gates did not socialize or attend parties with him.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Met with Bill Gates in a meeting arranged by Jeffrey Epstein at Apollo's New York offices. Had a multifaceted business and personal relationship with Epstein.

connections.description: Had multiple meetings, dinners, and flights together; Epstein pitched his services to Gates. Gates reportedly remarked about his unhappy marriage in Epstein's presence.

events.title: Bill Gates first meets Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Bill Gates first meets Jeffrey Epstein and later emails colleagues describing Epstein's lifestyle as "very different and kind of intriguing although it would not work for me."

events.title: Gates-Epstein dinner with Melinda
events.description: Bill and Melinda Gates have dinner with Jeffrey Epstein at his Manhattan townhouse. Melinda expresses her discomfort with the association afterward.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein dies by suicide in federal custody shortly after being charged with sex trafficking of girls.

events.title: NYT article on Gates-Epstein relationship
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article detailing Bill Gates's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, reporting they spent time together on multiple occasions, including flights on Epstein's jet and gatherings at his townhouse.

events.title: Epstein introduces Gates to Leon Black
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein brings Bill Gates to meet Leon Black, head of Apollo Investments, at Apollo's New York offices.

keyFacts: Melinda French Gates's decision to seek a divorce from Bill Gates was at least partly due to her displeasure with his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
Bill Gates and Jeffrey Epstein spent time together on multiple occasions, including flights on Epstein's private jet and late-night gatherings at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.
In 2013, Melinda French Gates expressed unease after she and Bill had dinner with Epstein at his townhouse.
Bill Gates reportedly remarked in Epstein's presence that he was unhappy in his marriage.
Jeffrey Epstein arranged a meeting between Bill Gates and Leon Black, head of Apollo Investments, after 2013.
